Sentencas: Chromia-forming ferritic stainless steel (FSS) is a highly promising interconnect material for application in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Surface Structure Analysis of Initial High-Temperature Oxidation of SS441 Stainless Steel

Sentencas: In this study, initial oxidation of chromium oxides was performed at 500-800 degrees C to understand the evolution of materials at an early stage.
Titulo: Surface Structure Analysis of Initial High-Temperature Oxidation of SS441 Stainless Steel

Sentencas: The structural variations in oxide scales were analyzed through scanning electron microscopy, energy dispersive spectroscopy (EDS), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), X-ray diffractometry (XRD), laser confocal microscopy (LSCM), X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), and Raman spectroscopy.
Titulo: Surface Structure Analysis of Initial High-Temperature Oxidation of SS441 Stainless Steel

Sentencas: Surface electrochemical properties were investigated through electrochemical impedance spectroscopy to understand how the heat treatment temperature affected surface impedance.
Titulo: Surface Structure Analysis of Initial High-Temperature Oxidation of SS441 Stainless Steel

Sentencas: Treatment temperatures higher than 700 degrees C facilitate the diffusion of Cr and Mn, thus allowing ferritic spinels to form on the surface and leading to high electrical conductivity.
Titulo: Surface Structure Analysis of Initial High-Temperature Oxidation of SS441 Stainless Steel
